text: Love the coffee and French fries and the space.

While visiting Montréal, tried the Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee and the Florentine Eggs Benedict. The Florentine was fantastic and the home fries were absolutely delicious. The blue mountain coffee was fresh and smooth but I was expecting a bit more considering the price and hype. Overall still a fabulous experience and I would definitely come back again. I was full from the breakfast all day!

J'ai poussé la porte de la Brûlerie en quête d'un petit déjeuner "traditionnel" pour m'aider à affronter le grand froid Canadien. Le résultat, sous la forme d'une assiette bien garnie baptisée "l'Empereur", a dépassé mes attentes: deux pancakes (qu'on arrose comme il se doit de sirop d'érable), quatre tranches épaisses de pain grillé, des oeufs brouillés, du bacon, des patates légèrement frites et pour se donner bonne conscience, un quart d'orange, une tranche d'ananas et une de melon. Rajoutez à cela un grand café et un grand jus d'orange fraîchement pressé, et pour un peu moins de $12, ça fait autant de raisons d'y revenir!
The owners are honest but the manager is a little brash. The waiters are pressuring you for tips.The space could be better set up in this place. Good teas and coffee.
This is no longer a Brûlerie St-Denis, the franchise has been removed from the owners & it is now a different business.
The croissant is really good. I don't usually eat croissant but this one is soft and the butter flavour.

Très bon restaurant. Le menu est de type "brunch" mais a pas mal de choix. Vous pouvez manger une grosse assiette avec pancakes et patates ou un sandwich santé.

Les prix sont raisonnables. Le service est rapide et efficace.

Ils ont un très grand choix de cafés et de thés. De plus, les horaires sont très pratiques.

Très recommandé !

This cafe is now called Bistro Urbaine and it's even worse than the former Brulerie St-Denis! The morbidly obese manager gave me a wet glass with my beer, which may have been improperly cleaned. I never wanted to set foot in there but we were with a little kid and there's not much else open after 9pm. St-Hubert would have been a better option. The food is very basic and not creative or good - the poutine fries were old, burnt and horrible. What keeps this place going is the coffee and other hot beverages, which are often served at room temperature - happened to me with a hot chocolate. Avoid this place and CDN cafes in general!

Came for a brunch study session on a cold Thursday with my cousin.

They have a special 7$ breakfast menu before 10:30am! 
We both got the plate with 2 eggs, choice of meat, bread, fruits, and breakfast potatoes.
Despite the food being standard as other places, I really liked it. The eggs, potatoes, and bacon were my standouts.
We also were allowed some coffee with the deal, I wish I had been able to substitute it with milk or hot chocolate but it's only tea/coffee. 
They don't refill the coffee even if you stay a long time, so keep in mind if you were planning on staying all day. We were there for about 3 hours.

I love the decor here, it felt very train station in France (from a movie).

I'd definitely come back, I want to try all their other options.

Wow je suis allé prendre le petit déjeuner là et j'ai beaucoup aimé! Le déjeuner "le week-end" comporte 2 ufs, pommes de terre maison, bacon, jambon, saucisse, rôties et une délicieuse crêpe. Les goûts sont parfaits. Les pommes de terre sont épicés donc pas besoin de rajouter sel et poivre. Le service est bien et les prix plus que raisonnables. On termine le tout par un bon café spécialisé pour bien commence la journée. J'adore!

La Brûlerie Saint-Denis, ça n'a rien de bien exceptionnel, les plats offerts sont assez basiques, c'est sandwiches, paninis, poutine,..., c'est simple mais pas mauvais ! Ils ont pas mal de choix en dessert, j'ai plusieurs fois pris leur gâteau et à chaque fois, j'ai plutôt été satisfaite, ça ne vaut pas un gâteau d'une bonne pâtisserie mais ça ne goûte pas l'industriel à 100%. Par contre, un conseil, ne prenez pas les milkshakes, c'est cher pour ce que c'est, mon amie en avait pris un au moka, et ca ressemblait plus à un verre de lait avec un peu de café....  L'endroit, un peu sombre à mon goût mais reste agréable pour discuter entre amis. Petit plus, en été ils ont une terrasse exposée au soleil.

Pretty place to meet up with people to study. 

I ordered a chai latte and the drink tasted amazing. It was the best chai latte that I had in Montreal. The spice and the milk were creamy like it melt on my mouth. I also ordered a salad with salmon. However, I had a hard time eating the salmon, I kinda wish they cut it for me instead of I do it myself. 

Awesome place to have quality drinks nonetheless. They have different drinks to satisfy even the pickiest of the drinker. Thus, it gets 4 stars from me.

This place was previously a Brulerie St-Denis with amazing coffee, but since they changed to Brulerie Urbaine the quality went downhill. 
I got a cocoa hollandais with l'ecureuil (a pastry), I was not impressed by them. The hot coco tasted like it was made with supermarket's coco powder, it was too heavy and I felt nauseous after finishing it. The pastry was smaller than my palm, and costed $7. Honestly I can get a pack of 5 for $10 in a nearby grocery store. 

What really thrown me off was that the waitress never cleaned the table when we sat down. It had sauce and crumbles all over it. We waited 10 min and ended up cleaning the table ourselves. The waitress  brought the bill when we were only half way through, it felt like she was rushing us. Bad experience.

Trés grand choix de cafés ici en provenance de partout dans le monde et avec la possibilité  de les arômatiser. J'ai testé le latté aux noix de pécans qui était bon mais sans plus par contre, le latté framboise-chocolat est trés bon en plus d'être original. J'avais choisi un café simple qui, bien que bon, n'était pas exceptionnel.
La Brûlerie Saint Denis propose aussi des café a emporter pour un dollar et des latté pour deux dollar ce qui est une plutôt bonne affaire et de manière générales, les prix étaient corrects.
L'endroit est trés grand pour un café qui fait également restaurant mais ne propose rien de vegan ce qui est a déplorer.

Très belle place.
Choix variés d'assiettes pour le brunch et service très agréable.
Le thé et le café sont de très bonnes qualité et de plusieurs provenances.

The service is really bad, which is a shame because they have such a big variety of coffees, but the place is definitely not for coffee lovers. Everyone is in such a rush that you feel like you have to leave immediately after you eat, and apparently the whole variety of coffees is only to go, they don't have a menu for the people who sits there which I don't understand. The prices for the coffee are nowhere to be seen, if you want to add a croissant you have to wait until they bring you the ticket to see how much does it cost... Such a shame.

They make great espresso, a great breakfast & brunch, as well as burgers and paninis. Service is usually prompt and courteous. I'm quite happy to keep coming back here even after moving out of the area.
